intro: Justicia longifolia, commonly known as the slender flame flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Justicia longifolia thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
